intro: Tetratheca floribunda, commonly known as the slender tetratheca, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1 meter, featuring narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with four petals, typically in shades of white or pale pink, which bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal heathlands and sand dunes. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
